desserts.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick or 113 grams) of unsalted butter
Optional: Powdered sugar or vanilla ice cream for garnish
instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Grease and lightly flour four individual ramekins or custard cups.

In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the semi-sweet chocolate and butter together. You can microwave them in 30-second intervals, stirring in between until fully melted. Alternatively, you can melt them in a double boiler on the stove.
In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together the granulated sugar, eggs, egg yolks, vanilla extract, and salt until well combined.
Slowly pour the melted chocolate and butter mixture into the egg mixture, stirring continuously.
Gradually add the all-purpose flour to the mixture and stir until the batter is smooth and well incorporated.
Divide the batter equally among the prepared ramekins or custard cups.
Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 12-14 minutes. The edges of the cakes should be set, but the centers will still be slightly soft.
Remove the ramekins from the oven and let them cool for a couple of minutes. You can run a knife around the edges to loosen the cakes, then invert them onto serving plates.
Dust the cakes with powdered sugar and serve them warm. You can also add a scoop of vanilla ice cream or whipped cream as a garnish if desired.
Enjoy your homemade chocolate lava cakes!

desserts.name: Berry Parfait
ingredients: 1 cup of mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
instructions: In a bowl, mix the Greek yogurt and honey until well combined.
In serving glasses or bowls, layer the yogurt mixture, mixed berries, and granola.
Repeat the layers until all the ingredients are used, finishing with a layer of mixed berries and granola on top.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve chilled and enjoy this refreshing berry parfait!

desserts.name: Vanilla Cupcakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick or 113 grams) of unsalted butter, softened
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a cupcake pan with paper liners.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk. Begin and end with the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly among the cupcake liners, filling each about two-thirds full.
Bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove the cupcakes from the pan and let them cool completely on a wire rack.
Once cooled, frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting and decorate as desired.
Enjoy these delightful vanilla cupcakes!

desserts.name: Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick or 113 grams) of cold unsalted butter, cubed
instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the cold cubed butter to the flour mixture. Use a pastry cutter or your fingertips to cut the butter into the flour until it resembles coarse crumbs.
Pour in the cold milk and vanilla extract. Stir until just combined. Do not overmix; the dough will be slightly sticky.
Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and gently knead it a few times to bring it together. Pat the dough into a 1-inch thick rectangle.
Using a round biscuit cutter, cut out shortcakes from the dough and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the shortcakes are golden brown.
Remove the shortcakes from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack.

To assemble the strawberry shortcakes, split the shortcakes in half horizontally. Fill each bottom half with sliced strawberries and a dollop of whipped cream. Place the top half of the shortcake on the filling.
Serve the strawberry shortcakes immediately and enjoy!

desserts.name: Blueberry Cheesecake
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (150 grams) of graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup (1 stick or 113 grams) of unsalted butter, melted
2 cups (450 grams) of cream cheese, softened
instructions: Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C). Grease the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
In a mixing bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan to form the crust.
In a separate mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy.
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
In a small bowl, toss the blueberries with flour until coated. Gently fold the blueberries into the cream cheese mixture.
Pour the cream cheese mixture over the crust in the springform pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 60-70 minutes or until the center is set and the top is lightly browned.
Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, run a knife around the edges to loosen the cheesecake.
Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours or overnight to allow it to set completely.
Before serving, remove the sides of the springform pan and transfer the cheesecake to a serving plate.
Slice and serve the delicious blueberry cheesecake!

drinks.name: Mojito
ingredients: 1 ounce (30 ml) of fresh lime juice
instructions: In a glass, muddle the mint leaves and sugar together to release the mint oils.
Add the fresh lime juice and muddle a bit more to dissolve the sugar.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and pour in the white rum.
Top off with club soda or sparkling water.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint and a lime wedge, if desired.
Enjoy your refreshing mojito!

drinks.name: Piña Colada
ingredients: Pineapple slices and maraschino cherries for garnish
instructions: In a blender, combine the white rum, pineapple juice, coconut cream, and ice cubes.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into a glass and garnish with pineapple slices and maraschino cherries.
Serve chilled and enjoy your tropical piña colada!

drinks.name: Margarita
ingredients: 1 ounce (30 ml) of fresh lime juice
1 teaspoon of agave nectar or simple syrup
instructions: Rim the glass with salt by running a lime wedge around the rim and dipping it in salt.
In a shaker, combine the tequila, fresh lime juice, triple sec, agave nectar or simple syrup, and ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds.
Fill the salt-rimmed glass with ice cubes and strain the margarita into the glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.
Enjoy your classic margarita!

drinks.name: Old Fashioned
ingredients: 2 ounces (60 ml) of bourbon or rye whiskey
1 sugar cube or 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar
instructions: Place the sugar cube or granulated sugar in a glass.
Add the dashes of Angostura bitters and muddle together to dissolve the sugar.
Add a few ice cubes to the glass.
Pour in the bourbon or rye whiskey.
Stir gently to combine the ingredients.
Express the oils from the orange peel twists over the drink and drop them into the glass.
Enjoy your classic old fashioned!

drinks.name: Gin and Tonic
ingredients: Lime wedges or slices for garnish
instructions: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour in the gin.
Top off with tonic water.
Stir gently to mix the ingredients.
Garnish with lime wedges or slices.
Enjoy your refreshing gin and tonic!
